abstract: Investors in the stock market and big banks are increasingly at odds over the type of capital the banks will need to withstand a severe economic downturn.
snippet: Investors in the stock market and big banks are increasingly at odds over the type of capital the banks will need to withstand a severe economic downturn.
lead_paragraph: Big banks keep insisting that they have all the capital they need  a claim that might strike many people as absurd at a time the government is spending billions of taxpayer dollars to prop up the financial industry.

headline.main: Stress Test for Banks Exposes Rift on Wall St.
headline.print_headline: Stress Test For Banks Exposes Rift On Wall St.

abstract: Former Merrill Lynch chief John Thain testified Tuesday for the second time in less than a week about bonuses paid to Merrill employees before the company was sold to Bank of America.
lead_paragraph: Former Merrill Lynch chief John Thain testified Tuesday for the second time in less than a week about bonuses paid to Merrill employees before the company was sold to Bank of America.

abstract: It’s the big guessing game on Wall Street and in Washington these days: How much equity will the government need to supply this time to pump up confidence in Citigroup and Bank of America — and will it lead to government control of America’s banking giants?
lead_paragraph: It’s the big guessing game on Wall Street and in Washington these days: How much equity will the government need to supply this time to pump up confidence in Citigroup and Bank of America — and will it lead to government control of America’s banking giants?
